org.opentrafficsim.car.lanechanging

Class SafeLaneChange

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opentrafficsim.car.lanechanging.SafeLaneChange

  • public final class SafeLaneChange
extends Object
    This utility class implements the Safety Criterion as described in Traffic Flow Dynamics by Martin Treiber and Arne Kesting, ISBN 978-3-642-32459-8 ISBN 978-3-642-32460-4 (eBook), 2013, Chapter 14.3.1, pp 242-243.

    Copyright (c) 2013-2014 Delft University of Technology, PO Box 5, 2600 AA, Delft, the Netherlands. All rights reserved.
    BSD-style license. See OpenTrafficSim License.

    Version:
    Sep 19, 2014
    Author:
    Peter Knoppers

      static boolean safe(Car referenceCar, Car otherCar, DoubleScalar.Rel<AccelerationUnit> maximumDeceleration, DoubleScalar.Abs<SpeedUnit> speedLimit)
      Determine if dangerous decelerations are incurred if a Car changes into a lane where another Car is driving.

    • Method Detail

      • safe

        public static boolean safe(Car referenceCar,
           Car otherCar,
           DoubleScalar.Rel<AccelerationUnit> maximumDeceleration,
           DoubleScalar.Abs<SpeedUnit> speedLimit)
        Determine if dangerous decelerations are incurred if a Car changes into a lane where another Car is driving.
        This implements the Safety Criterion as described in Traffic Flow Dynamics by Martin Treiber and Arne Kesting, ISBN 978-3-642-32459-8 ISBN 978-3-642-32460-4 (eBook), 2013, Chapter 14.3.1, pp 242-243.
        Parameters:
        referenceCar - Car; the car following model of this car is used to determine the needed acceleration (deceleration).
        otherCar - Car; the car driving in the other lane
        maximumDeceleration - DoubleScalar.Abs<AccelerationUnit>; the maximum (considered safe) deceleration (must be positive; something on the order of 2m/s/s)
        speedLimit - DoubleScalar.Abs<SpeedUnit>; the speed limit
        Returns:
        Boolean; true if the resulting deceleration is safe; false if the resulting deceleration is unsafe
